org.ejvm.execution

Class EjvmProcess

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ejvm.execution.EjvmProcess

  • public class EjvmProcess
extends Object

    Represents a process in an EjvmMachine to execute an EjvmProgram and manages the associated resources.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sebastian Nicolai Kaupe
    See Also:
    EjvmMachine, EjvmProcessor, EjvmProgram

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  EjvmProcess.OutputFormatter
      Simple enum to represent the output mode set for a process.
      static class  EjvmProcess.ProcessState
      Simple enum to represent the process state.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int MAIN_METHOD_FRAME_RETURN_ADDRESS
      The value stored in the field for the return address in the stack frame for the main method.
      static int STACK_FRAME_PREAMBLE_SIZE
      Size of the stack frame preamble, made up out of the method index byte, the old program counter and the old frame pointer.
      static int STACK_VALUE_SIZE
      Size of a stack value, e.g. a local variable or working value.

        The value stored in the field for the return address in the stack frame for the main method.

        See Also:

        See Also:

        Size of a stack value, e.g. a local variable or working value.

        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • getLocalVariable

        public short getLocalVariable(int index)

        Retrieves the value of the local variable at index from the local variable section of the stack frame.

        Please remember that method parameters are also stored in the local variable section.

        Parameters:
        index - The variable index.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the variable index if negative or bigger than the number of local variables allows.

      • getProgramCounter

        public int getProgramCounter()

        Returns the current value of the process's program counter.

        Returns:
        The current PC value.

      • getStackPointer

        public int getStackPointer()

        Returns the current value of the process's stack pointer.

        Returns:
        The current SP value.

      • getFramePointer

        public int getFramePointer()

        Returns the current value of the process's frame pointer.

        Returns:
        The current FP value.

      • getProcessState

        public EjvmProcess.ProcessState getProcessState()

        Returns the current status of the process.

        Returns:
        The current process state.

      • getExecutableView

        public ByteBuffer getExecutableView()

        Returns a view of the complete executable as a read-only ByteBuffer, i.e. the process memory minus heap and stack.

        Returns:
        A ByteBuffer offering read-only access to the complete memory area inhabited by the executable.

      • getCurrentMethodIndex

        public int getCurrentMethodIndex()

        Reads the method table index for the currently executed method from the stack and returns it.

        Returns:
        The index of the currently executed method in the method table.

      • getStackView

        public ByteBuffer getStackView()

        Returns a view of the complete stack as a read-only ByteBuffer.

        Returns:
        A ByteBuffer ranging from the position of the stack pointer to the end of the working memory assigned to this process.

      • getProgram

        public EjvmProgram getProgram()

        Returns the program executed in this process.

        Returns:
        The EjvmProgram executed in this process.

      • getInput

        public InputStream getInput()

        Returns the InputStream that is used as the process' input channel.

        Returns:
        The InputStream delivering input to this process.

      • getInputAsReader

        public InputStreamReader getInputAsReader()

        Returns the input channel of this process as an InputStreamReader to ease the reading of character data.

        Returns:
        This process' input channel as InputStreamReader.

      • setInput

        public void setInput(InputStream inputStream)

        Sets this process' input channel to inputStream.

        Parameters:
        inputStream - The InputStream the process is meant to receive input from.

      • getOutput

        public PrintStream getOutput()

        Returns the PrintStream that is used as the process' output channel.

        Returns:
        The PrintStream receiving output from this process.

      • setOutput

        public void setOutput(PrintStream writer)

        Sets this process' output channel to writer.

        Parameters:
        writer - The PrintStream the process is meant to send output to.

      • getOutputFormatter

        public EjvmProcess.OutputFormatter getOutputFormatter()

        Returns the EjvmProcess.OutputFormatter that is used for this process.

        Returns:
        The EjvmProcess.OutputFormatter.

      • setOutputFormatter

        public void setOutputFormatter(EjvmProcess.OutputFormatter formatter)

        Sets this processes output formatter to formatter.

        Parameters:
        formatter - The EjvmProcess.OutputFormatter for the process.

      • addExecutionListener

        public void addExecutionListener(EjvmExecutionListener listener)

        Add another EjvmExecutionListener to this process.

        Parameters:
        listener - The new EjvmExecutionListener.

      • removeExecutionListener

        public boolean removeExecutionListener(EjvmExecutionListener listener)

        Removes the EjvmExecutionListener listener from this process.

        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to be removed.
        Returns:
        true if the listener was removed. See Set.remove(Object) for details about the requirements.
